title: 'I wanted to eliminate any doubt as to why I was taking a leadership role': the female CEO of Belstaff talks shop and gender
text:
Should she ever tire of life as a high-flying CEO, Helen Wright could be an excellent barista. "I make a great coffee," she says as she greets me at Belstaff's HQ in Chelsea, leading me to a staff café where she expertly froths oat milk on an expensive-looking, professional coffee machine, even attempting some latte art. But her tiring of CEO life is unlikely, and besides, she'd be outrageously overqualified for the job.

Wright, 52, joined Belstaff in January 2018, after two and a half years as CEO of Anya Hindmarch and, prior to that, senior roles at Karl Lagerfeld, Fendi and Bamford. Retail - brands, products, customers and the 'magic' that unites them - is her lifeblood. As a teenager in the...
